She supports Jonathan's career.

description: KL Rahul's magnificent, unbeaten 176 propelled India A to a historic victory against Australia A in the second Unofficial Test, securing the series 1-0. India A chased down a record 412, the highest ever by an 'A' side, surpassing Australia A's previous record.

title: Supreme Court defers Vodafone Idea plea against extra AGR demand to October 6
description: A Bench headed by CJI B.R. Gavai agreed to an oral request made by Solicitor General Tushar Mehta, appearing for DoT, to defer the hearing to October 6

title: ‘Will make tougher to work illegally’: UK to introduce digital ID for workers - How it will work
description: UK Prime Minister Keir Starmer has revealed plans for a free digital ID system for nationals and residents, aiming to curb illegal immigration and simplify access to government services. The digital ID, stored on smartphones, will streamline applications for various services and be mandatory for proving the right to work.

Study reveals offshore wind farm cables affect female crabs and marine ecosystems
description: Research indicates that subsea cables from offshore wind farms, while crucial for clean energy, emit electromagnetic fields affecting marine life. Female shore crabs are particularly vulnerable, exhibiting altered behaviour near cables, which disrupts their migrations and breeding. These disruptions could cascade through coastal food chains, highlighting the need for smarter planning and mitigation strategies in offshore energy development.

title: Can AI detect colorectal cancer through a simple stool test? Study shows 90 per cent accuracy
'Paper chor': Rahul's new attack after 'vote chori' charge; points to exam leaks
description: Rahul Gandhi has accused the BJP government of being a "paper chor" amid rising outrage over examination leaks, particularly the UKSSSC paper leak in Uttarakhand. He linked the issue to his earlier allegations of "vote chori," arguing that unemployment and electoral malpractice are connected. Gandhi declared his support for protesting students, calling the crisis a fight for justice and democracy.

Salman Khan opens up about his battle with neurological disorder trigeminal neuralgia
description: The trigeminal nerve which runs through the face, becomes the target of chronic pain in patients who have TN. The trigeminal nerve divides into three sections that transmit sensory information to the forehead, cheek, jaw and eye areas. The trigeminal nerve experiences irritation or compression which results in brief, yet intense electric shock-like pain that affects only one side of the face

title: Local Loudmouths: And we thought only humans had that skill
India-US trade pact: Big update on Goyal's visit; aim for 'early conclusion'
description: India and the US are committed to progressing towards a trade agreement, as stated by the Ministry of Commerce & Industry. During Commerce Minister Piyush Goyal's visit to the US, both sides discussed potential aspects of the deal and agreed to continue discussions for a mutually beneficial outcome.

title: War of words! Kaif responds to Bumrah: 'Take it as an observation'
description: A debate sparked between Mohammad Kaif and Jasprit Bumrah after Kaif questioned Bumrah's workload management during the Asia Cup, particularly under Suryakumar Yadav's captaincy. Bumrah sharply refuted Kaif's observations on social media. Kaif responded calmly, framing his remarks as a well-wisher's perspective, emphasizing Bumrah's crucial role for India, particularly in high-profile games.

title: Nia Jax reveals why she hid her family ties from WWE officials
description: Nia Jax, cousin of Dwayne "The Rock" Johnson, initially concealed her Anoa’i family ties upon entering WWE. She aimed to prove her worth independently, participating in the first tryout at the NXT Performance Center. Jax has since become a prominent WWE performer, securing championships and earning respect for her perseverance, marking a unique journey built on her own merits.

description: Indian representatives have told the Trump administration that significant cuts in Russian oil imports would require access to alternative crude from sanctioned nations like Iran and Venezuela. During discussions in the US, the Indian delegation reiterated concerns that blocking access to oil from these producers could trigger global price increases.

The petition challenged the Special Court's acceptance of a complaint filed against him regarding remarks he made about Sikhs during a visit to the United States in September 2024. This legal challenge stems from the aftermath of his comments made abroad.

Phil Simmons, Bangladesh coach, lamented the missed opportunities and poor batting decisions that led to their 11-run defeat. India's fielding has also been a concern, with 12 dropped catches in five matches.

description: Donald Trump's tariff move impacts Indian pharma stocks. Companies like Sun Pharma, Cipla, and Dr. Reddy's face potential declines. US represents a major market for Indian exports.

title: 'Dangerous alien': US arrests another 'illegal' Indian for multi-vehicle crash
description: Partap Singh, an undocumented Indian, was arrested after a multi-vehicle crash. The crash critically injured a five-year-old girl and her father. Homeland Security criticized California Governor Gavin Newsom for issuing Singh a commercial driver’s license. This is the second such case this year. Earlier, Harjinder Singh was charged with vehicular homicide in Florida.

title: PM Modi sends Rs 10,000 to 75 lakh women in Bihar; details about the scheme
description: Prime Minister Narendra Modi launched the Mukhyamantri Mahila Rojgar Yojana in Bihar, transferring ₹10,000 to 75 lakh women. The ₹7,500 crore scheme aims to empower women through self-employment, offering additional financial support up to ₹2 lakh for entrepreneurial ventures. Beneficiaries can use the funds for agriculture, handicrafts, and other small enterprises, fostering economic independence and development in the state.

description: Indians in the UAE are gearing up for auspicious gold purchases with Pushya Nakshatra on October 14-15 and Dhanteras on October 18-19, 2025. Pushya Nakshatra, linked to Goddess Lakshmi, offers a 20-hour window for buying gold. Dhanteras extends the Muhurat for over 19 hours, favoring gold, silver, and utensil acquisitions.

description: Shoaib Akhtar believes Pakistan can defeat India in the Asia Cup 2025 final by dismissing Abhishek Sharma early and maintaining an aggressive mindset. Akhtar emphasized the importance of targeting Sharma in the initial overs, suggesting that his early dismissal could destabilize the Indian batting lineup. He also anticipates Gautam Gambhir will motivate India to bring their best game against Pakistan.

description: In Indore's Heera Nagar, Rajendra Chaurasia allegedly ran over his ex-girlfriend with an Activa after she refused to reconcile. The incident occurred in Kalpana Nagar, following an argument where Rajendra insisted they live together. CCTV footage captured him speeding towards her, even as she tried to defend herself.

Martina Navratilova sparks row over Melania Trump’s viral look at Donald Trump
description: Martina Navratilova ignited controversy by commenting on Melania Trump's expression during the UN General Assembly in New York, suggesting she despises her husband. This followed Navratilova's criticism of Donald Trump's behavior at the US Open final, where she noted his lack of applause and the security delays caused by his presence, further highlighting her outspoken opposition to the former president.

title: Dentures ‘your fault’: What US authorities told 73-year old grandma when she refused ice
description: Harjit Kaur, a 73-year-old woman who lived in the US for 30 years, faced deportation after her asylum applications were denied. During her detention, she was allegedly denied proper medical care, food, and basic hygiene.

title: Maoists allege 'fake encounter'; claim police arrested CC members, then killed them
description: Following a reported encounter in Abujhmarh forest, a dispute has erupted between Chhattisgarh police and the CPI (Maoist). The police claim to have killed two central committee members, but the Maoist outfit alleges a "fake encounter," asserting that the commanders were arrested beforehand. Police refuted the allegations, suggesting the Maoist statement is a reaction to check police response.

title: Teenager flees home abuse in UP, survives gang rape in Jaipur
description: A 15-year-old girl, fleeing abuse in Uttar Pradesh, endured gang rape in Jaipur, leading to the tragic delivery of a stillborn child. After escaping her stepfather's torment in Gorakhpur, she met Krishna in Ajmer, who brought her to Jaipur and allegedly assaulted her. Later, Krishna's friend, Bacchan, also repeatedly raped her.

title: UP doctors remove 29 spoons, 19 toothbrushes, 2 pens from man’s stomach
description: Surgeons in Hapur were astonished to discover 29 steel spoons, 19 toothbrushes, and two pens inside a 40-year-old man's stomach during an emergency surgery. The patient, admitted to a Ghaziabad de-addiction center, complained of severe abdominal pain.

title: H-1B fee hike: Why US workers were replaced by foreigners; senators ask tech giants
description: US lawmakers, led by Senators Grassley and Durbin, are questioning major companies like Amazon, Apple, and JPMorgan about their H-1B hiring practices amidst job cuts. They demand data on H-1B worker numbers, wages, and potential displacement of American workers. This scrutiny follows the Trump administration's new $100,000 H-1B visa fee, which the US Chamber of Commerce may challenge in court.

title: Ousmane Dembélé net worth 2025: PSG star’s salary, career and family
description: Ousmane Dembélé's star shines brightly in 2025, boasting a $35 million net worth and a lucrative PSG contract. His remarkable season culminated in a Ballon d'Or win and a Champions League title. Endorsements with Adidas and other brands contribute significantly to his income, solidifying his status as a top earner both on and off the field.

title: Heart disease & leg pain: Peripheral Artery Disease (PAD) symptoms explained
description: Leg pain during walking could signal Peripheral Artery Disease (PAD), indicating clogged arteries and increased risk of heart attack and stroke. Early detection through tests like ABI is crucial, especially for those with risk factors such as smoking or diabetes. Addressing PAD through lifestyle changes and medical interventions can protect both legs and heart.

title: 'They didn’t want a Black character': Gabrielle Union on being rejected from movie
description: Gabrielle Union, wife of Dwyane Wade, recently spoke about facing discrimination in Hollywood. She revealed being rejected for a role due to her ethnicity. Union wanted to be in 'Sugar and Spice' but was turned down. She also discussed beauty standards and how they affected her career. Despite challenges, Union has achieved success. Her marriage with Wade inspires many.

title: Top H‑1B employers in 2025 : Amazon, Microsoft, Meta & others - check list
description: Amazon secured the most H-1B visa approvals in the first half of 2025, followed by TCS, Microsoft, Meta, and Apple. These tech giants utilize the program to employ skilled professionals in specialized roles.
